meanings.sent1: The teacher's lesson was the stodgiest one we had all year.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so stodgy that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent3: The stodgiest sandwich I ever had was made with stale bread and expired cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her stodgy speech put everyone in the room to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The stodgiest painting in the gallery had no colors and no life.

meanings.sent1: The museum exhibit was the stodgiest display I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The lecture was so stodgy that even the professor seemed bored.
meanings.sent3: The stodgiest book on the shelf had a cover that put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: His stodgy jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The stodgiest party I attended had no music and no laughter.

meanings.definition: Having a heavy or unappetizing quality
meanings.sent1: The stew had the stodgiest taste, making it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent2: The cake looked delicious, but it turned out to be the stodgiest dessert ever.
meanings.sent3: The stodgiest casserole at the potluck was a mystery meat surprise.
meanings.sent4: The air in the room felt stodgy and stale, like it hadn't been freshened in years.
meanings.sent5: The stodgiest dish on the menu was a greasy, overcooked mess.
